revised_title: Description of a Metal Thermometer and Its Inventor
tldr: The author describes a metal thermometer invented by Mr. Samuel Frotheringham and constructed by Mr. John Ingram. The thermometer is composed of an iron staff, a brass bar, and a series of levers and chains that move an index to display the temperature. The inventor, Mr. Samuel Frotheringham, had previously created a similar device in 1735 but did not publish it until later.
